title: Opening remarks by SFH on appointment of new HA Chairman (with photo)
content_text:
p>
			Following is the opening remarks made by the Secretary for Food and 
			Health, Dr Ko Wing-man, when meeting the media with the Chairman of 
			the Hospital Authority (designate), Professor John Leong Chi-yan, at 
			the lobby of West Wing, Central Government Offices, this afternoon 
			(October 8): I am glad to announce that the Chief Executive has appointed 
			Professor John C Y Leong as the Chairman of the Hospital Authority. 
			Professor Leong's term of appointment will be two years with effect

Professor Leong's term of appointment will be two years with effect 
			from December 1 this year. Professor Leong's vast experience in the health-care sector and 
			public services as well as thorough understanding of the Hospital 
			Authority's operation made him eminently suitable for such an 
			appointment. I have every confidence in Professor Leong that, under his 
			leadership, the Hospital Authority would be able to rise to the many 
			challenges that would be faced by the Hospital Authority and

challenges that would be faced by the Hospital Authority and 
			continue to provide the public with quality medical services. I would also like to express my heartfelt gratitude to the outgoing 
			Chairman, Mr Anthony Wu, for his strong and effective leadership, 
			and unwavering commitment that he had demonstrated over the past 
			nine years. I am sure that Mr Wu will continue to take a close interest in the 
			work of the Hospital Authority and support the Government in our 
			effort to continuously improve the health-care services in Hong

effort to continuously improve the health-care services in Hong Kong. Ends/Tuesday, October 8, 2013
Issued at HKT 18:22
